title: Best and Most Beautiful Things
text:
Best and Most Beautiful Things is a 2016 <a href="documentary%20film">documentary film</a> directed by Garrett Zevgetis and produced by Zevgetis, Ariana Garfinkel, Jeff Consiglio, and Jordan Salvatoriello. The film's world premiere was held at the <a href="South%20by%20Southwest">South by Southwest</a> (SXSW) Film Festival on March 14, 2016, where it was nominated for a Jury Award for Best Documentary Feature.
Synopsis.
The film explores the coming of age of an exuberant and precocious young <a href="visual%20impairment">blind</a> woman, Michelle Smith, who identifies as being on the <a href="autism%20spectrum">autism spectrum</a>. As she tries various ways of finding her true self in a new world of adults, she struggles with family tensions and trying to keep a job. On a more personal level, she begins developing a sense of sexual identity through exploring aspects of <a href="sexual%20fetishism">fetishism</a>.
Critical reception.
In a December 1, 2016 review in "<a href="The%20New%20York%20Times">The New York Times</a>", Neil Genzlinger called the film "a remarkably forthright documentary" in which Ms. Smith makes "a difficult transition for someone with disabilities - the end of the schooling years, with their structure and relative safety." The same review named the film a "New York Times" "Critics' Pick."
